trans-unit.source: Provides methods used to render a check box control with or without visual styles.
This class cannot be inherited.
The CheckBoxRenderer class provides a set of `static` methods that can be used to render a check box control.
Rendering a control refers to drawing the user interface of a control.
To draw a check box, use one of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckBoxRenderer.DrawCheckBox%2A> methods.
These methods provide a variety of options, such as drawing text or an image with the check box.

If visual styles are enabled in the operating system and visual styles are applied to the current application, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckBoxRenderer.DrawCheckBox%2A> will draw the check box with the current visual style.
Otherwise, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckBoxRenderer.DrawCheckBox%2A> will draw the check box with the classic Windows style.
This is useful if you are drawing a custom control that should automatically match the current visual style setting of the operating system.

This class wraps the functionality of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer?displayProperty=fullName> that is set to one of the elements exposed by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.Button.CheckBox?displayProperty=fullName> class.
For more information, see [Rendering Controls with Visual Styles](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Draws a check box control in the specified state and location.
If visual styles are enabled in the operating system and visual styles are applied to the current application, this method will draw the check box with the current visual style.
Otherwise, it will draw the check box with the classic Windows style.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to draw the check box.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> to draw the check box glyph at.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.CheckBoxState"></xref> values that specifies the visual state of the check box.
Draws a check box control in the specified state and location, with the specified text, and with an optional focus rectangle.
If visual styles are enabled in the operating system and visual styles are applied to the current application, this method will draw the check box with the current visual style.
Otherwise, it will draw the check box with the classic Windows style.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to draw the check box.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> to draw the check box glyph at.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> to draw `checkBoxText` in.
The <xref:System.String> to draw with the check box.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> to apply to `checkBoxText`.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to draw a focus rectangle; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.CheckBoxState"></xref> values that specifies the visual state of the check box.
Draws a check box control in the specified state and location, with the specified text and text formatting, and with an optional focus rectangle.
If visual styles are enabled in the operating system and visual styles are applied to the current application, this method will draw the check box with the current visual style.
Otherwise, it will draw the check box with the classic Windows style.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to draw the check box.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> to draw the check box glyph at.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> to draw `checkBoxText` in.
The <xref:System.String> to draw with the check box.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> to apply to `checkBoxText`.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TextFormatFlags"></xref> values.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to draw a focus rectangle; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.CheckBoxState"></xref> values that specifies the visual state of the check box.
Draws a check box control in the specified state and location, with the specified text and image, and with an optional focus rectangle.
If visual styles are enabled in the operating system and visual styles are applied to the current application, this method will draw the check box with the current visual style.
Otherwise, it will draw the check box with the classic Windows style.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to draw the check box.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> to draw the check box glyph at.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> to draw `checkBoxText` in.
The <xref:System.String> to draw with the check box.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> to apply to `checkBoxText`.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Image"></xref> to draw with the check box.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that represents the dimensions of `image`.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to draw a focus rectangle; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.CheckBoxState"></xref> values that specifies the visual state of the check box.
Draws a check box control in the specified state and location; with the specified text, text formatting, and image; and with an optional focus rectangle.
If visual styles are enabled in the operating system and visual styles are applied to the current application, this method will draw the check box with the current visual style.
Otherwise, it will draw the check box with the classic Windows style.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to draw the check box.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> to draw the check box glyph at.

A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TextFormatFlags"></xref> values.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Image"></xref> to draw with the check box.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that represents the dimensions of `image`.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to draw a focus rectangle; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.CheckBoxState"></xref> values that specifies the visual state of the check box.
Draws the background of a control's parent in the specified area.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to draw the background of the parent of `childControl`.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> in which to draw the parent control's background.
This rectangle should be inside the child controlâ€™s bounds.
The control whose parent's background will be drawn.
Returns the size of the check box glyph.
The size of the check box glyph is determined by the current visual style of the operating system.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> this operation will use.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.CheckBoxState"></xref> values that specifies the visual state of the check box.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> that represents the size of the check box glyph.
Indicates whether the background of the check box has semitransparent or alpha-blended pieces.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.CheckBoxState"></xref> values that specifies the visual state of the check box.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the background of the check box has semitransparent or alpha-blended pieces; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the renderer uses the application state to determine rendering style.

If the RenderMatchingApplicationState property is `true`, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckBoxRenderer> uses the setting from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Application.RenderWithVisualStyles%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to determine the rendering style.
If RenderMatchingApplicationState is `false`, the renderer will always render using visual styles.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the application state is used to determine rendering style; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
